Text: Re Storage Volumes Sold to EnronI just got off the phone with Rich Contos he wants me to find out if Enron concurs with the storage volumes sold I think Ernie Simien or Doug Kinney had sent some volumes and associated dollar amounts to you to look at Let me know if Enron is in concurrance Phone is and you can see the email address Thanks The Donald

Re Ashland Chemical Jan Feb Mar Cc Still trying to get Ashland straight Thanks for the information yesterday Enron Ashland are TCO are all of the same accord in that all are saying that the gas came from Enron and not CES The problem is that CES has paid Enron for this same per day for those three months This is what we have confirmed with TCO as wellthat CES did not make these volumes available to Ashland either We are showing that Enron invoiced and that CES paid for dths for these volumes in January for in February sb dth but we were invoiced and paid for and March was for again This makes for a total refund due CES of for these volumes This could be paid along with the storage imbalance sale to Enron for for a total of these two transactions of Thanks for your attention to this Call me if you have questions Don Kirkendall on AM Please respond to To Donald OLUMBIAGAS cc Subject Re Ashland Chemical Yes I wuz on AM To cc Subject Re Ashland Chemical Were you REALLY working Saturday night at on PM Please respond to To Donald OLUMBIAGAS cc Subject Re Ashland Chemical Hey Don Im still working on this I should have an idea by this Wed

Ashland ChemicalHave you been able to figure out if Enron has billed Ashland for Jan Feb and Mar on an old day Columbia contract If so please let me know so we can make the appropriate adjustment with the Ashland volumes Thanks
